creator: apachebugs@acrotect.com
text:
The description of apr_collapse_spaces() at http://apr.apache.org/docs/apr/1.3/group__apr__strings.html does not match its behavior according to http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/apr/apr/tags/1.3.5/strings/apr_cpystrn.c?view=co.

The documentation says:

Strip spaces from a string

Parameters:
dest 	The destination string. It is okay to modify the string in place. Namely dest == src
src 	The string to rid the spaces from.
Returns:
The destination string, dest.

I propose that it should say:

Removes all whitespace from a string

Parameters: (unchanged from above)
Returns:
A pointer to the destination string's null terminator.

creator: bojan@rexursive.com
text: Fixed. Thanks for pointing it out.
